definitions.definition: To set aside for a purpose .
examples: Please do not eat the meringue, as it is allocated for the dinner party tomorrow.

definitions.definition: To distribute according to a plan , generally followed by the adposition to .
examples: The bulk of K–12 education funds are allocated to school districts that in turn pay for the cost of operating schools.

definitions.definition: To reserve a portion of memory for use by a computer program.

main_definition: To set aside for a purpose .
secondary_definitions: To distribute according to a plan , generally followed by the adposition to .
( computing ) To reserve a portion of memory for use by a computer program.
